definition: Geoffrey Chaucer (1343-1400), English poet, author of The Canterbury Tales 坎特伯雷故事集[Kan3 te4 bo2 lei2 Gu4 shi4 Ji2]
Geoffrey Chaucer (1343-1400), English poet, author of The Canterbury Tales 坎特伯雷故事集[Kan3 te4 bo2 lei2 Gu4 shi4 Ji2]

sentences.english: Dhaucer is buried in "poet's Dorner", as might have been expected.
sentences.chinese: 正如許多人已經預料的，喬叟被葬在“詩人角”。

sentences.english: And Chaucer, of course, is laughing at this over-refinement.
sentences.chinese: 當然，喬叟是在笑話這些禮儀過分精細。

sentences.english: Chaucer was the father of English poetry.
sentences.chinese: 喬叟是英國的詩歌之父。

sentences.english: Geoffrey Chaucer is regarded as the father of English poetry.
sentences.chinese: 喬叟被看作是英國詩歌之父。
這在喬叟的作品中處處可見。

sentences.english: Chaucer is the father of English poetry.
Chaucer is the father of the English poetry.
Chaucer has been called the Father of English Poetry by successive generations.
sentences.chinese: 喬叟被後輩子的人稱爲英國詩歌之父。

sentences.english: Jeffery Chaucer was a medieval British poet, considered by the British people as "the father of poetry".
sentences.chinese: 喬叟是中世紀英國詩人，被英國人視爲“詩歌之父”。

sentences.english: George Washington is called the father of his country.
sentences.chinese: 喬叟是英國的詩歌之父。

sentences.english: These are all extracts from Chaucer.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是喬叟詩抄中的精萃。
